required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 2 Study of Oral K201 for Prevention of AF Recurrence
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Phase 2, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Multi-Centered Safety, Tolerability and Preliminary EffiCacy Study of K201 Oral for the Prevention of ATrial FIbrillation (AF) Recurrence in Subjects Post-Conversion From AF

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety, efficacy, and tolerability of 3 doses of K201 (oral) administered for up to 28 days in subjects with recent DC cardioversion to sinus rhythm from sustained symptomatic atrial fibrillation (AF duration >3 days and <6 months).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: time to first documented recurrence of symptomatic AF
time to first documented recurrence of symptomatic or asymptomatic AF
proportion of subjects in sinus rhythm
safety assessments: vital signs, laboratory assays, ECG parameters, physical exams, frequency of adverse events
